title: Skyrocketing Inflation Rates
description: In 2023, Zimbabwe experienced an inflation rate of 921.54% as measured by the GDP deflator, one of the highest in the world.

title: High Lending Interest Rates
description: Zimbabwe's lending interest rate reached 170.29% in 2023, making it one of the highest globally.

title: Significant Interest Rate Spread
description: In 2023, the interest rate spread in Zimbabwe was 107.47%, indicating a large gap between lending and deposit rates.

title: Negative Real Interest Rates
description: Zimbabwe recorded a real interest rate of -73.54% in 2023, reflecting the impact of high inflation on savings.

title: Rapid Broad Money Growth
description: The broad money supply in Zimbabwe grew by 708.93% in 2023, one of the fastest rates globally.

title: High Short-term Debt Reliance
description: In 2023, short-term debt accounted for 3409.70% of Zimbabwe's total reserves, indicating a heavy reliance on short-term borrowing.

title: Rapid Growth in Domestic Claims
description: Claims on other sectors of the domestic economy grew by 453.95% as a percentage of broad money in 2023, showcasing rapid expansion.

title: High Growth in Private Sector Claims
description: In 2023, claims on the private sector grew by 425.49% as a percentage of broad money, indicating robust private sector activity.

title: Negative Net Foreign Assets
description: Zimbabwe's net foreign assets stood at -18.86 trillion local currency units in 2023, highlighting significant external liabilities.

title: Strong Growth in National Income
description: Adjusted net national income grew by 38.98% in 2021, reflecting a significant increase in economic output.

title: Rising Income Per Capita
description: In 2021, adjusted net national income per capita grew by 36.60%, indicating improvements in individual economic well-being.

title: Social Protection for the Poorest
description: In 2019, 37.55% of social protection and labor benefits were directed to the poorest quintile, demonstrating targeted social support.

title: Minimal Health Expenditure Impact on Poverty
description: In 2017, only 1.82% of the population was pushed further below the poverty line due to out-of-pocket health expenses, indicating effective health cost management.

title: Tariff Specificity in Manufacturing
description: In 2016, 5.94% of tariff lines for manufactured products had specific rates, reflecting a nuanced trade policy.
